page.title: 12HIGH HURSTWOOD CHURCHES (1)
page.content: In the centre of our block is Holy Trinity, a thriving Anglican church built in l870. The parish is currently served by a non-stipendiary priest-in- charge, a retired Air Vice Marshal, who lives in the village. His con- gregation includes people from adjoining towns who, with those who live in the parish make up an electoral roll of 206. Average Sunday attendance at 3 services is 122. Music is provided by an honorary organist and choir of 8 adults and 4 children. In the past 12 months there have been 11 baptisms, 7 marriages and 9 funerals. Junior Church meets in the Village Hall, joining the adults once a month. Two Churchwardens and a Parochial Church Council of l4 assist and advise on both spiritual and material administration. This church receives no outside financial help
